CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 10, 1960, pg. 10 reads: "Negro Home Razed - Arrow points to pile of a few bricks which is all that is left of a house in North Braddock at 513 Seddon Ave., owned by Mrs. Loretta Hawkins, 142 Watkins Ave., Wilmerding. She and other Negro homeowners in North Braddock are alarmed over the razing, and charge that prejudice motivated borough officials to arbitrarily and suddenly tear down the home because Mrs. Hawkins' last set of Negro tenants caused disturbances in the quiet, residential, Seddon Ave. neighborhood.  Of 12 Negro homes in the immediate area, this is the second Negro home to be razed on the same street. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Empty lot with rubble left from razed home of Loretta Hawkins, 513 Seddon Avenue, North Braddock
